# AnimationRepeatMode.repeat

**Case**

A mode that restarts the animation after it completes.

## Declaration

```swift
case `repeat`
```

## Discussion

This mode restores the animated property to its initial value each time it restarts. For example, a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/FromToByAnimation] with [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/FromToByAnimation/fromValue-umpp] `=` `1.0`, [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/FromToByAnimation/toValue-4m4pm] `=` `2.0` and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/FromToByAnimation/repeatMode] set to this property repeats as, `1.0`, `2.0`, `1.0`, `2.0`, `1.0`, `2.0` and so on.

## Choosing a repeat mode

- **AnimationRepeatMode.cumulative**: A mode that repeats indefinitely and begins each repetition by setting the animated property to the ending value of the previous repetition.
- **AnimationRepeatMode.autoReverse**: A mode that reverses the animation after reaching the end or the beginning.
- **AnimationRepeatMode.none**: An option that determines the animation doesn’t repeat.
